result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sophia Shelton

records.addlTxt: Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ( $750.00 signature bond) LW
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Sophia Shelton not in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Sophia Shelton.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court forfeits bail.
Calendar call on September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff Schwarz called the Court on 8/18/2022 informing that he was just appointed counsel and requested a reschedule of the 9/6/2022 calendar call due to a conflict. 
Court allows calendar call to be rescheduled to 9/8/2022 at 8:30 a.m. Parties notified.
Calendar call on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sophia Shelton not in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 15.
  Calendar call scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Walmart, 6300 Brown Deer Road, Brown Deer WI, 53223
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Sophia Shelton in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Sophia Shelton in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.
  Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sophia Shelton not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@2p
